translated: The Chapter about the One who had the Perception of Sound
“To the Fortunate One Vipassī,🔽the world’s chief, the one who is patient,

analyzed: pasannena sa pāṇinā  hatthi yānam assa yāna
translated: with a pure mind and with my hands.🔽I rode on an elephant, I rode on a horse,
I rode on a divine vehicle,
Through that gift of a bed,
I attained the destruction of the pollutants.
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of the gift of a bed.
I have done what the Awakened One said.”🔽Thus the Elder Mañcadāyaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā mañcadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Mañcadāyakattherassāpadānaṁ aṭṭhamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā mañcadāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽mañcadāyaka therassa apadānam aṭṭhama
translated: The Elder Mañcadāyaka’s Birth Story, the eighth.
